result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas John Kirch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to Marinette Co. Case #15CF6

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Make all reasonable efforts to seek and maintain employment.
Pay all current child support and arrearages per family court order.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC/letter to Mr. Kirch returned
on Request for Extension of Probation (Denied)

11:43 am - Court calls case and states appearances. Defendant Douglas John Kirch appeared via video from Oshkosh Correctional, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states facts of case and determines that the Public defenders office does not need to provide attorney for DE.  Court will make decision on extending probation in the next few days.  Adjourned 11:45 am.
Hearing regarding extension of supervision 10/17/16 at 11:30 am.

10:35am Defendant Douglas John Kirch appeared by video in Taylor Co., in custody, by speaker phone.  Judge Knox-Bauer and Court Reporter Lisa Weber by speaker phone.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  This hearing was scheduled regarding extension of probation.  DA states why probation should be extended.  DE states reason why probation should not be extended.  Court will have her decision prior to discharge date of probation.  DE requests the court hold a hearing to review why DE is not eligible for a public defender.  The Court will hold that hearing in Price Co. on 10/17/16 at 11:30am (DE will be appearing via video)  Adj. 10:46am
regarding extension of supervision 10/3/16 at 10:30 am.
Hearing regarding Extension of Supervision 9/8/16 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: face sheet intake and investigation

9:25 am - Defendant Douglas John Kirch in court via video from Oshkosh Correctional with attorney James R. Lex in court in person.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated by DA. Comments by Atty. Lex. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Off record at 9:30 am. On record at 9:44 am. Comments by Atty. Lex. Court questions DE regarding adequate communication and right to appear in person. DA moves to amend to 948.22(3) Misd. A.  Amendment granted. DE pleads NO CONTEST to charge.   Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. Comments by DE. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:00 am. 
Court imposes:
Sentence withheld - 1 year probation, cc with Marinette Co. Case 15CF6
Conditions: 
Court costs
$65 SBDA
Make all reasonable efforts to seek and maintain employment
Pay all current child support and arrearages per family court order
Plea and sentencing on 10-22-15 at 9:30 am
Jury trial on 09-10-15 at 9:00 am
Jury Trial on 05-14-15 at 9:00 am

1:57 pm - Defendant does not appear.  Attorney James R. Lex appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  March 5, 2015 jury trial is adjourned and new date set of May 14, 2015. Parties state that no statements were made regarding motion to suppress.  Adj. at 1:58 pm.
Motion hearing on 02-19-15 @ 2:00 pm
Motion hearing on 01-08-15 at 10:00 am
Jury trial on 03-05-15 at 9:00 am

see minutes on today's date under preliminary hearing event

11:01 am - Defendant Douglas John Kirch appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver provided to Court.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary and accepts.  DA files information.  Parties have received and reviewed and waive reading.  DE pleads NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Comments regarding bond by Atty. Lex.  Comments by Court and DA.  Adj. 11:04 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Douglas John Kirch

Prior: N18805 Riverview Road, Pembine, WI 54156

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Sandra Vanderwyst, unless there is written consent on file.

10:10 am - Defendant Douglas John Kirch appeared with attorney James R Lex.  Mark T Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
